We're migrating a Java web application from one vendor's database to
another. The web application was nicely designed to require us to make a
change in just one spot to change the datastore. But I'm puzzled, then,
about how to do testing to verify that the results from the database
interactions are identical since I have to stop and start the application to
switch databases.

Does JUnit have a way to set aside one batch of objects so I can compare a
second set of objects in another run of the test? Or am I wandering down the
wrong road....?

Dave
